response: The question of whether chocolate or vanilla ice cream is better is subjective and depends on individual preferences. As explained in source [b], if one person says they prefer vanilla over chocolate, and another person says they prefer chocolate over vanilla, both of them are right. This is because the preference for a particular flavor of ice cream is a fact about those individuals' brains, not about the ice cream itself. Therefore, neither chocolate nor vanilla ice cream can be objectively said to be better than the other. It's all a matter of personal taste.

b.title: Vanilla and chocolate and preference judgements
b.author: Swimmer963
